table_title: Scoring Rubric Used for Evaluating Responses Across the Six Thinking Dimensions

criteria.name: Persona fidelity (PF)
criteria.description: Adherence to the specified role’s content and style constraints.

criteria.name: Coverage (COV)
criteria.description: Completeness relative to the remit (e.g., accuracy, trust, liability, oversight).

criteria.name: Specificity (SPEC)
criteria.description: Use of precise, concrete details; avoidance of generic statements.

criteria.name: Actionability (ACT)
criteria.description: Presence of clear, feasible next steps where appropriate.

criteria.name: Distinctiveness (DIST)
criteria.description: Clear differentiation from other personas’ outputs.

evaluation_question.question: Should governments impose a carbon tax on all businesses as a strategy to combat climate change? Discuss economic impact, fairness, risks of unintended consequences, and long-term beneﬁts.

expected_output_structure.overall_score: float (mean of six criteria, rounded to 2 decimals)

justification.summary: Concise paragraph explaining rationale of the scoring
Evidence-led assessment with strong factual balance.
strengths: Balanced view of accuracy and oversight
